video.name: VEGAN CREAMED SPINACH Withe Herbed Biscuit Topping| Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Vegan Creamed Spinach. Simple Creamy Delicious Spinach baked with non dairy cream and topped with herbed cheesy biscuit topping.
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2019/11/vegan-creamed-spinach.html

Creamed Spinach makes for a delicious side in the holiday season. Spinach, kale or other greens cooked with herbs, garlic and cheesy vegan cream and served as is or with, cheesy biscuit topping! Lets raise that bar on Vegan Creamed Spinach.

This Creamy Spinach Gratin comes together really quickly with just 7 ingredients. Once the mixture is slightly thickened, top with the quick cheesy biscuit topping and bake!
Review:"This was so delicious and simple to make. Even my 4 and 6 year old kiddos were begging for seconds. We served it as our main dish so Iâ€™ll definitely be doubling the recipe next time.
Adding to our weekly rotation!"

#veganricha #easyveganrecipes #creamedspinach #vegancreamedspinach
Music EpidemicSound

recipeIngredient: 16 oz frozen spinach (, thawed for 10 mins, or use chopped fresh spinach)
3/4 cup all purpose flour (, see not for gluten-free)
1 tsp dried herbs ((I use rosemary and oregano))
1/2 cup + 2 tbsp non dairy milk (,such as light coconut milk, soy milk or unsweetened almond milk)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the cast iron skillet over medium heat. Add oil. Add oregano, black pepper and pepper flakes and mix for a few seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the cast iron skillet over medium heat. Add oil. Add oregano, black pepper and pepper flakes and mix for a few seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add onion and garlic and 1/8 tsp salt. Cook until translucent. (3 to 5 mins)
recipeInstructions.name: Add onion and garlic and 1/8 tsp salt. Cook until translucent. (3 to 5 mins)

recipeInstructions.text: Add the thawed spinach and continue to cook until the water is almost gone. (If using other hardly greens or a mix, cook the hardy greens to wilt and then add spinach)
recipeInstructions.name: Add the thawed spinach and continue to cook until the water is almost gone. (If using other hardly greens or a mix, cook the hardy greens to wilt and then add spinach)

recipeInstructions.text: Add the non dairy cream and salt and mix in. Take off heat. You can add 1 tbsp nutritional yeast or 1/2 tsp miso and mix in, for cheesier creamed spinach. (You can refrigerate this creamy spinach for upto a day)
recipeInstructions.name: Add the non dairy cream and salt and mix in. Take off heat. You can add 1 tbsp nutritional yeast or 1/2 tsp miso and mix in, for cheesier creamed spinach. (You can refrigerate this creamy spinach for upto a day)

recipeInstructions.text: Make the topping: Mix the flours and dry ingredients in a bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the topping: Mix the flours and dry ingredients in a bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1/2 cup non dairy milk and mix in. Add milk 1 tbsp at a time to make a thick muffin like mixture. Drop spoonfuls over the spinach.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1/2 cup non dairy milk and mix in. Add milk 1 tbsp at a time to make a thick muffin like mixture. Drop spoonfuls over the spinach.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 400 deg F (205 C) for 25 mins. Broil for a minute to crisp up the biscuits if needed. Serve hot!Store the leftovers in the refrigerator for upto 2 days. Reheat in the oven for 10 mins or so.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 400 deg F (205 C) for 25 mins. Broil for a minute to crisp up the biscuits if needed. Serve hot!Store the leftovers in the refrigerator for upto 2 days. Reheat in the oven for 10 mins or so.
